cwe_description: The product reads data past the end of the intended buffer. This can lead to crashes, information disclosure, or other undefined behavior.
explanation: The code performs an out-of-bounds read when parsing the num_bootstrap_methods field. After an initial offset increment of 6 bytes, the R_BIN_JAVA_USHORT macro attempts to read 2 bytes from the buffer at the current offset. If the total buffer size (sz) is less than 8 bytes, this read will access memory beyond the allocated buffer, leading to a crash or information disclosure.

cwe_description: The software reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of an intended buffer. This can lead to crashes, information disclosure, or other undefined behavior.
explanation: The code attempts to read a 2-byte unsigned short for num_bootstrap_methods using R_BIN_JAVA_USHORT(buffer, offset) where offset is 6. This operation reads bytes from buffer[6] and buffer[7]. If the provided buffer size sz is less than 8 bytes, specifically if sz is 7, then buffer[7] will be an out-of-bounds read, potentially leading to a crash or information disclosure. There is no bounds check before this read.
